action.content:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the potted plant on the side table, the book in the refrigerator and the plate on the shelf.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter, a table and a cupboard. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a pantry, a living room and a hallway here.
The cupboard is now open. In the cupboard there is a plate.
You take the plate. In your inventory you have a plate.
You are in a living room now. There are a book, a couch and a chair. The book is on the table. There are passages to a hallway, a bedroom and a kitchen here.
You can't see a table here.
I don't know how to interpret this 'look' action.
Livingroom is not an entity. (this should not occur.)
There is nothing on the couch.
There is nothing on the chair.
The book is takeable. The book is on the table.
You can't see a table here.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter, a table and a cupboard. The cupboard is open. There are passages to a pantry, a living room and a hallway here.
You put the plate on the table.
You are in a living room now. There are a book, a couch and a chair. The book is on the table. There are passages to a hallway, a bedroom and a kitchen here.
You are in a bedroom now. There are a wardrobe, a side table and a bed. The wardrobe is closed. There is a passage to a living room here.
The wardrobe is now open. In the wardrobe there is a pillow.
You are in a living room now. There are a book, a couch and a chair. The book is on the table. There are passages to a hallway, a bedroom and a kitchen here.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter, a table, a cupboard and a plate. The cupboard is open. The plate is on the table. There are passages to a pantry, a living room and a hallway here.
You are in a pantry now. There are a freezer and a refrigerator. The freezer is closed. The refrigerator is closed. There is a passage to a kitchen here.
The refrigerator is now open. In the refrigerator there are a apple, a peach, a sandwich, a orange and a banana.
You can't see a book here.
You can't go to a living room from here.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter, a table, a cupboard and a plate. The cupboard is open. The plate is on the table. There are passages to a pantry, a living room and a hallway here.
You are in a living room now. There are a book, a couch and a chair. The book is on the table. There are passages to a hallway, a bedroom and a kitchen here.
You can't see a table here.
The book is not on the floor.
The book is takeable. The book is on the table.

> go to kitchen
> go to pantry
> put book in refrigerator
You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter, a table, a cupboard and a plate. The cupboard is open. The plate is on the table. There are passages to a pantry, a living room and a hallway here.

> go to pantry
> put book in refrigerator

You are in a pantry now. There are a orange, a peach, a apple, a sandwich, a freezer, a banana and a refrigerator. The orange is in the refrigerator. The peach is in the refrigerator. The apple is in the refrigerator. The sandwich is in the refrigerator. The freezer is closed. The banana is in the refrigerator. The refrigerator is open. There is a passage to a kitchen here.

> go to kitchen
> go to living room
> go to bedroom
> put potted plant on side table
